listicle_content.listicle: Saurabh Shrestha, who was fifth to be examined by a 15-member panel expert panel, shocked the panel members when they asked him the formula for integration by parts (Calculus). To this question, panel sources say that Saurabh warned them not to ask such questions or else he would commit suicide.
The panel members were taken aback by Saurabh\'s threat and they stopped the re-examination immediately. After a short interval, he was asked few more questions and was later asked to leave.
The panel was asking both objective as well as subjective questions to students to find out whether they deserved to be toppers or not.
Sources say that Saurabh even said he was under massive stress ever since the India Today had exposed his academic proficiency and he was not in a position to answer any questions of the panel.
Saurabh immediately after coming out of the examination hall said that very soon the truth would be out. \"My exams have gone well and very soon the world will come to know the truth,\" he said.

The Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) on Saturday cancelled his result of the Intermediate (Science) examinations, including Sourabh Shrestha, after he failed to prove their merit in a retest. The Board said that Saurabh had failed to perform well and the Board does not find him up to the mark and he doesn\'t deserve to be a topper.

story.storykicker: Bihar Science 'topper' Saurabh Shrestha on the day of his re-examination had threatened to commit suicide.
story.storybody:
Bihar Science 'topper' Saurabh Shrestha on the day of his re-examination said he will commit suicide if he is cross-examined.

HERE'S WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW:

{funfacts}
  1. Saurabh Shrestha, who was fifth to be examined by a 15-member panel expert panel, shocked the panel members when they asked him the formula for integration by parts (Calculus). To this question, panel sources say that Saurabh warned them not to ask such questions or else he would commit suicide.
  2. The panel members were taken aback by Saurabh's threat and they stopped the re-examination immediately. After a short interval, he was asked few more questions and was later asked to leave.
  3. The panel was asking both objective as well as subjective questions to students to find out whether they deserved to be toppers or not.
  4. Sources say that Saurabh even said he was under massive stress ever since the India Today had exposed his academic proficiency and he was not in a position to answer any questions of the panel.
  5. Saurabh immediately after coming out of the examination hall said that very soon the truth would be out. "My exams have gone well and very soon the world will come to know the truth," he said.
  6. The Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) on Saturday cancelled his result of the Intermediate (Science) examinations, including Sourabh Shrestha, after he failed to prove their merit in a retest. The Board said that Saurabh had failed to perform well and the Board does not find him up to the mark and he doesn't deserve to be a topper.
{funfacts}

ALSO READ | Bihar Class 12 toppers fail retest, board cancels results

Saurabh said he was under massive stress after the India Today expose.
The Bihar board cancelled his result after he failed to prove merit in a retest.
